intro: Lessingia leptoclada, commonly known as the slenderleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapting to arid environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland desert regions.
